notes.note: Start sparging with 1.7 L water @ 72 C

name: Batch

batchFermentables.notes: BEST Pilsen Malt gives beer a fresh and rounded taste. It is used for all types of beers based on basically berley malt. It forms an excellent “light” and enzyme-rich foundation for almost all beer styles.  Malt characteristics: low protein levels, high extract content, light color and high enzymatic activity. BEST Pilsen Malt is also available in organic quality.
batchFermentables.name: Pilsen Malt
Wheat Malt
batchFermentables.notes: BEST Wheat Malt emphasises the effervescent freshness and the typical top-fermented flavor of wheat beer. It is produced from high quality brewing wheat. Malting processes adapted to the raw material highlight the particular qualities of this malt.

batchYeasts.name: SafBrew Ale
batchYeasts.description: General purpose ale yeast with neutral flavor profiles. Its low attenuation gives beers with a very good length on the palate. Particularly recommended for specialty ales and trappist type beers. Yeast with a medium sedimentation: forms no clumps but a powdery haze when resuspended in the beer.

tasteNotes:
27-05-2020 20:05 A bit sour, still cloudy and fruity. Day 6 of fermenting. Gravity from 1.060 to 1.024. Just a couple of days before bottling.
14-06-2020 16:25 opened a half filled bottle, gave a small puff, poured hazy with some small bubbles and no foamy head, no lacing, slightly darker color than expected, tasted sour and boozy, very light carbonation.
05-07-2020 15:12 light foam which dissolves quickly, very light carbonation, little hint of orange, sour.
18-07-2020 18:51 cooled and served @ 7 C, light carbonation, no foam, sour taste.
07-08-2020 16:46 cooled and served @ 7 C, light carbonation, no foam, sour taste.
03-09-2020 18:51 cooled and served @ 7 C, light carbonation, no foam, sour taste.
18-09-2020 19:44 cooled and served @ 7 C, Another of the first brew. Taste is getting better ... probably growing on me. Better foam, still dissolving quickly, not lacing, better carbonation, quick dissolving foam, sour taste.
03-10-2020 17:47 cooled and served @ 7 C, light foam which dissolves quickly, very light carbonation, little hint of orange, sour taste.

yeasts.description: General purpose ale yeast with neutral flavor profiles. Its low attenuation gives beers with a very good length on the palate. Particularly recommended for specialty ales and trappist type beers. Yeast with a medium sedimentation: forms no clumps but a powdery haze when resuspended in the beer.
